column4: How can you ur ip address show somwthing like daajeh.something.net and change it as you want ?
Bu 1) having control of a netblock 2) owning the domain in question and and 3) running a DNS server
By 1) having control of a netblock 2) owning the domain in question and and 3) running a DNS server
thanks
Well, normally they wouldn't do the second part at all, but you might be lucky.
Can you explain more please
hummmm. I see urs like i.am.cafuego.geek.nz
how do you get to do that?
I have a rackmounted server at a hosting provider, which comes with up to 32 IP addresses (for an extra charge) that I can configure to use with any domain names I have also bought.
The hosting provider owns the IP addresses and allow me to customise how they appear via an interface to add or chnage entries on their domain name server.
: How about you? how much you pay?
Around AU$300 per month
(for a managed server and a handful of addresses)
dollars?
Yes
too much!
No, not really.
Well, it IS too much if all you want is a custom reverse dns entry.
I never mentioned the US. Bah.
This is a server that hosts web and mail for 80+ clients, not just a toy so i can have a cute name on irc ;-)
how much would it be in U.S?
